title: 40 Indian Workers Kidnapped In Iraq
teaser: NPR’s Julie McCarthy discusses the status of the abducted Indians, and what measures the Indian government is taking to free them.
contentencoded:
Forty of Indian workers have been kidnapped in the city of Mosul — and it is not yet known where they are, or why they were taken. An estimated 10,000 migrant workers from India reside in Iraq, and some 6 million total in the Middle East region.

NPR’s Julie McCarthy talked to Here & Now’s Sacha Pfeiffer about the status of the abducted Indians, and what measures the Indian government is taking to free the workers.

Guest

  • Julie McCarthy, international correspondent for NPR, based in New Delhi, India. She tweets @JulieMcCarthyJM.
